data.title: A great Italian meal
data.text: We had a wonderful Italian meal last evening. The service was spot on!  We had the carpaccio, two amazing pastas and the swordfish and pork scaloppini. All were excellent. It was a hopping place and we look forward to our next visit!  Wine list was very good and not over priced.

data.title: Top Rate all around
data.text:
This restaurant is one of the true gems of Iowa City's cuisine scene. The Chef/Owner is one of the good guys in the restaurant world. He's devoted to authentic Italian food, prepared and served in a special way. He's a nice guy that checks on his customers and cares about the product he puts out. This attitude is also seen in his professional staff. I wish I saw more of this in the local scene.

Food is delicious. I'm no expert, but I would think much of the menu would be classified as "Northern" Italian, but since he also specializes in fresh seafood, there seems to be quite a range of Italy's specialties represented. Wine selection is extensive.

A great special occasion restaurant that is on my short list for repeat visits.

data.title: Best Italian Restaurant
data.text:
This is the best Italian restaurant around-authentic north Italian food-great food coupled with good service-very welcoming owner/chef John always comes around to enquire about the food!
Only negative is the small cramped space!

data.title: Italian delight
data.text: Have been to Baroncini's twice, both times our table was visited by the owner to assure our satisfaction - the owner was making contact with all the tables each time - impressive attention to service! And indeed the service was very good. The food also very good- last visit had a pleasant seafood dish, dining partner had a rabbit dish that was very good.  Very nice atmosphere, although a little dark to read the menu. Would go here more often, but a little pricey so must reserve this place for special occasions. Reservations a very good idea.

data.title: Over-rated
data.text: The place is SMALL, we had 6 adults jammed into a booth and we had reservations.  Our server took 20 minutes to bring wine, another 25 minutes to take our order, and in total a simple evening meal took almost 3 hours and that included begging for the bill.  As in common in most Iowa City places, the clientele were dressed like they just finished working in a field.  Cargo shorts, (please they went out of style 4 years ago guys!) peasant long dresses with WalMart sandals on women, I mean zero fashion for supposedly one of the "best" eating places?  The food was good to very good, although they were out of some items at 6pm? Entree pricing is about $18 - $25 for most iems with ala carte for salads etc.  Won't be going back anytime soon, which is sad, because this town has literally 1 or 2 decent restaurants with atmosphere.

data.title: One of the best Iowa City restaurants
data.text: This restaurant is one of the best downtown Iowa City dinner establishments.  We had the scallops and lobster pasta, it was outstanding.  The service and atmosphere is perfect.  Just an FYI it is a small space they have booths which are nice but the tables are pretty close together.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: We had a business lunch meeting here and found it a lovely place to find fine dining in the trendy downtown Iowa City. We were visiting with an Iowa City local, who recommended this restaurant as it is his favorite. The place was first class with well appointed features making for a neat atmosphere as it has a renovated vintage look. The food was excellent and very traditional. They offer a nice lunch smaller portion menu.

data.title: Taste the home made pasta and you are Italy
data.text: Really top notch home made pasta as good as Italy's finest. My favorite is the truffle linguini. Rich, flavorful and perfectly made, this is a memorable dish. Every thing we have had here is very good. The atmosphere is fine dining in a small quiet restaurant. I eat at fine Italian restaurants in my travels and remarkably this one holds up very well.

data.title: Dinner experience so-so
data.text: Monday night at 7:30 dinner.  Placed order.  Server brought a salad we did not order. Kitchen out of scallops we ordered. Kitchen out of lobster bisque.  At 8:30, we last two guests and music died.  Staff went to the kitchen.  We sat in quiet till I opened music on my phone.  Crab arrived and was under cooked and deep fried greasy.  The ravioli was very good.   They started closing up while we ate at 9:00.  We arrived at 7:30 and there were 4 people eating so it took 1.5 hours to get our meal?  Must have been an off night.

data.title: Remarkable
data.text: In Iowa City to visit, was told that Baroncini's was the best restaurant in Iowa City and they were absolutely "on target".  I was a tad bit leery because of the college town environment surrounding it, but were we in for a very pleasant surprise.  Quaint and small but bustling with patrons who obviously knew what we were about to experience....that the food rivals anything I've had anywhere.  The chef/owner checked on us 3X to make sure it was to our liking and the remaining staff were extremely attentive.  The food however was the highlight...outstanding.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

data.title: Best for dinner
data.text: Sometimes Baroncini is in top form, and the pasta alone is heavenly.  Other times the food can seem a bit -- uninviting.  For example, we tend to eat early, and at lunchtime we've sometimes been among the first in the restaurant, which at that time of day can smell like bathroom cleaning detergent.  The tension between the soapy smell and the food accounts for some of my disappointment, so my advice is to go in the evening when things are in full swing.

data.title: The best place in Iowa City
data.text: Baroncini is the best place to eat in Iowa City. The service is always very attentive and the entrees are always delicious. I have had some lovely vegetable appetizers here as well.  I think the pasta is good, but the meat dishes are where the restaurant really shines.  The desserts are also wonderful, and the cheesecake is transcendent.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: Highly recommend! The food was excellent.  The beef tenderloin was done perfect with great flavor. My wife had lobster pasta that was incredible.  Lobster was served in the tail so plenty of food. We started with the blue crab salad.  Plenty to share. Staff was very good!  The chef stopped by to make sure everything was just right and it was!

data.title: Cozy, with a nice Italian vibe
data.text: This is best Italian restaurant in Iowa City. It's a small restaurant with limited seating, so it is a good idea to make reservation. The menu changes daily, so everything is prepared fresh with much care. The menu has good variety and everything I've tasted has been  absolutely superb. The delicious breads are house-made and are real killers. On this most recent visit I had lobster served with pasta, while one of my companions had the salmon entrée.  The restaurant has an extensive Italian wine list and I had to rely on the waitress for a recommendation.  On this visit our service was a little slow and we were seated at a noisy table close to the kitchen.  Overall, my experience has been much better on earlier visits.  I come back for the great Italian food, I just love the lasagna here and the other pasta dishes are terrific too. The tables tend to be crowded pretty close together, but the atmosphere is warm and friendly.  Call it cozy, with a nice Italian vibe.

data.title: Lovely presentation, great service
data.text: A white table cloth ristorante, many memorable meals here.  Have been here for special dinners as well as date night.  Great variety, beautiful presentation, nice wine list.  A gem!

data.title: Primo Italian food with a Chicago atmosphere
data.text: I have never had a bad meal here. The food is tremendous! I tried a white wine, shrimp and porcini mushrooms pasta last night that was earthy and rich. Soft lighting, attentive service and an excellent bottle of wine round out the meal. We are so fortunate to have this type of quality, locally owned restaurant in Iowa City!

data.title: Oh my gosh, this food!!!
data.text: Holy cow this food is amazing. Every time I go I'm shocked at how much better food can be when made by a genius. I've never had better food! On our last visit we had octopus salad, crab and lobster salad, tenderloin, duck (not pictured), and cheesecake (not pictured).

data.title: Best Italian food I've had since Italy
data.text: I lived for two months in Italy, and Chef Baroncini's pasta dishes always make me feel like I'm right back in Umbria. It's no wonder, because the pasta is homemade in house daily. But that's not the only delicious part of the menu. The beef carpaccio appetizer is spot on, and I've yet to order a bad dessert from the always changing dessert options. The servers are always polite and professional, and the atmosphere is cozy and secluded. I'd recommend making a reservation, because the limited seated can be a problem if you just show up. But I've never had trouble waiting to be seated because we always make a reservation. Overall, Baroncini is a tiny piece of Italy hidden in Iowa City of all places...a must for any Italian food lover!

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in the Iowa City area.  Menu changes regularly and a terrific wine list as well.

data.title: One of the three best Northern Italian dinners that we've ever had....and the other two were in Northern Italy.
data.text: One of the three best orthern Italian dinners that we've ever enjoyed. Chef and owner Baroncini is a first class hands on host.
